exam_sections.translation_content: 从前,有个农夫正在地里耕作,突然看见一只兔子飞奔而过,撞在一棵大树上死了。农夫毫不费力就吃到了兔肉,心里非常高兴。他想,"如果总是这样该多好啊!"于是,他不再耕作,每天守候在那棵树旁,等待着能再捡到撞死在树上的兔子。他等呀等,等了一天又一天,田地也荒芜了,却再也没有等到第二天兔子。人们因而都嘲笑他把偶然当成了必然。
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write a proposal to your school clinic for improving its service, including current problems and possible solutions.
exam_questions.correct_answer: The school clinic has been playing a critical role in our campus life. However, with university lockdown, problems have emerged. Therefore, I, a junior from Law School, am writing to make a proposal on improving its service. The problems and suggestions are as follows. First of all, many kinds of vaccines are only available at off-campus hospitals, which is quite inconvenient. Since our school hospital has professional doctors, why not provide relevant vaccination services on campus? Secondly, it has been quite tiring and time-consuming to have a thorough physical check-up owing to the huge number of students. Hence, an appointment App or a similar system will be indispensable to improve efficiency. In addition, it will be better if necessary emergency medical aid training can be offered. The commitment of our school clinic is appreciated by all students and faculty. I sincerely hope that my proposal can be adopted and our school clinic can provide better healthcare services.

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.correct_answer: There was once a peasant who was ploughing in the field. Suddenly he saw that a hare darting past bumped against a large tree and died. He enjoyed a meal of hare meat without any effort and was so pleased that he thought, "How wonderful it would be to have this all the time!" So he stopped plowing and waited by that tree every day for picking up another hare that bumped into the tree. He waited and waited day after day, only to have the field waste rather than a second hare. Therefore, people all laughed at him for taking the accidental for the inevitable.
